intro: Lasianthemum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have alternate, simple, and often hairy leaves, and they produce small, clustered flowers with five petals. The flowers are usually greenish or yellowish and bloom in early spring. They are often found in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils.
